imports.value: Publish, LastWill, Unsubscribe, Connect, Suback, Subscribe, PacketIdentifier

defs.docs:
A pure rust mqtt client which strives to be robust, efficient and easy to use.
 * Eventloop is just an async `Stream` which can be polled by tokio
 * Requests to eventloop is also a `Stream`. Solves both bounded an unbounded usecases
 * Robustness just a loop away
 * Flexible access to the state of eventloop to control its behaviour

attributes.value: ! A pure rust mqtt client which strives to be robust, efficient and easy to use.
! * Eventloop is just an async `Stream` which can be polled by tokio
! * Requests to eventloop is also a `Stream`. Solves both bounded an unbounded usecases
! * Flexible access to the state of eventloop to control its behaviour
! Build bounded, unbounded, interruptible or any other stream (that fits your need) to
! **Few of our real world use cases**
! - A stream which orchestrates data between disk and memory by detecting backpressure and never (practically) loose data
! - A stream which juggles data between several channels based on priority of the data
! Networks are unreliable. But robustness is easy
! - Just create a new stream from the existing eventloop
! - Access the state of the eventloop to customize the behaviour of the next connection
! Eventloop is just a stream which can be polled with tokio
! - Plug it into `select!` `join!` to interleave with other streams on the the same thread
! Powerful notification system to control the runtime
! Eventloop stream yields all the interesting event ranging for data on the network to
! disconnections and reconnections. Use it the way you see fit

defs.docs: Options of the current mqtt connection

attributes.value: / Options of the current mqtt connection

defs.name: EventLoopError
defs.value: EventLoopError::{MqttState, Timeout, Rumq, Network, Io, StreamDone, RequestsDone}

defs.name: eventloop
defs.value: fn (options: MqttOptions, requests: impl Requests + 'static) -> MqttEventLoop
defs.docs:
Returns an object which encompasses state of the connection.
 Use this to create a `Stream` with `stream()` method and poll it with tokio.

attributes.value: / Returns an object which encompasses state of the connection.
/ Use this to create a `Stream` with `stream()` method and poll it with tokio.
/ The choice of separating `MqttEventLoop` and `stream` methods is to get access to the
/ internal state and mqtt options after the work with the `Stream` is done or stopped.
/ This is useful in scenarios like shutdown where the current state should be persisted or
/ during reconnection when the state from last disconnection should be resumed.
/ For a similar reason, requests are also initialized as part of this method to reuse same
/ request stream while retrying after the previous `Stream` has stopped
/ When mqtt `stream` ends due to critical errors (like auth failure), user has a choice to
/ For example, state and requests can be used to save state to disk before shutdown.
/ Options can be used to update gcp iotcore password

defs.name: connect
defs.value: fn <'eventloop> (&'eventloop mut self) -> Result<impl Stream<Item = Notification> + 'eventloop, EventLoopError>
defs.docs:
Connects to the broker and returns a stream that does everything MQTT.
 This stream internally processes requests from the request stream provided to the eventloop
 while also consuming byte stream from the network and yielding mqtt packets as the output of
 the stream

attributes.value: / Connects to the broker and returns a stream that does everything MQTT.
/ This stream internally processes requests from the request stream provided to the eventloop
/ while also consuming byte stream from the network and yielding mqtt packets as the output of

defs.name: set_clean_session
defs.docs:
`clean_session = true` removes all the state from queues & instructs the broker
 to clean all the client state when client disconnects.

attributes.value: / `clean_session = true` removes all the state from queues & instructs the broker
/ to clean all the client state when client disconnects.
/ When set `false`, broker will hold the client state and performs pending
/ operations on the client when reconnection with same `client_id`
/ happens. Local queue state is also held to retransmit packets after reconnection.
